wikipedia_page.main: Christopher David Fry (born 23 October 1969) is a Welsh former professional footballer.

response: Born in Brighton, Allen was on the books at Premier League club Wimbledon for two years prior to his release in the summer of 1994. Unable to break into the first team, he joined Gillingham for a short stint until he was signed by Colchester United manager George Burley. Allen made just two Football League substitute appearances for the club, the first as a replacement for Paul Abrahams in a 1–0 win against Hartlepool United at Layer Road on 10 September 1994, and in the second he came on for Chris Fry in a 3–2 away victory at Darlington on 24 September. Shortly after this, Allen was released from Colchester as Burley built up his squad.
